author: @newspaper
title: ന്യൂനപക്ഷങ്ങൾക്കെതിരേ അക്രമങ്ങൾ കൂടി -ഷബ്‌നം ഹാഷ്‌മി
text:
തേഞ്ഞിപ്പലം: 2014-ൽ മോദി സർക്കാർ അധികാരത്തിലേറിയശേഷം ഇന്ത്യയിൽ ന്യൂനപക്ഷ ജനവിഭാഗങ്ങൾക്കെതിരേയുള്ള അതിക്രമങ്ങൾ വർധിച്ചതായി പ്രമുഖ മനുഷ്യാവകാശ പ്രവർത്തകയും ആക്ടിവിസ്റ്റുമായ ഷബ്നം ഹാഷ്മി പറഞ്ഞു. കാലിക്കറ്റ് സർവകലാശാലാ ഇ.എം.എസ്. ചെയർ ഫോർ മാർക്സിയൻ സ്റ്റഡീസ് ആൻഡ് റിസർച്ചിൽ ന്യൂനപക്ഷവിഭാഗങ്ങളുടെ പാർശ്വവത്കരണത്തെക്കുറിച്ച് സംസാരിക്കുകയായിരുന്നു അവർ.
2014-ന് ശേഷമുള്ള നാലുവർഷത്തിൽ അതിക്രമങ്ങൾ 27.3 ശതമാനം വർധിച്ചതായാണു കണക്കുകളിലുള്ളത്. ഹത്രസ്, കത്വാ, ബൽക്കീസ് ബാനു (ഗുജറാത്ത് കലാപം) തുടങ്ങിയ സംഭവങ്ങളിൽ കുറ്റക്കാരുടെ ജയിൽമോചനം ആഘോഷമാക്കിയ മനുഷ്യരെക്കുറിച്ച് ആശങ്കയുണ്ട്. വിദ്യാഭ്യാസമേഖലയിലെ ന്യൂനപക്ഷ സ്കോളർഷിപ്പുകളും മറ്റും നിർത്തലാക്കുന്നത് വലിയ പ്രതിസന്ധികൾ സൃഷ്ടിക്കുമെന്നും അവർ പറഞ്ഞു.
[Contact Us](javascript:void(0))
ചെയർ വിസിറ്റിങ് പ്രൊഫസർ ഡോ. കെ.വി. മോഹനൻ അധ്യക്ഷനായി. ചെയർ കോഡിനേറ്റർ പി. അശോകൻ, വി. സ്റ്റാലിൻ, വി.എസ്. നിഖിൽ എന്നിവർ സംസാരിച്ചു.

author: Redacción Deportes
title: Lara González lamenta la dura derrota ante Brasil en balonmano: "No hemos sido las guerreras" - El Partidazo de COPE - COPE
text: EL PARTIDAZO DE COPE Lara González lamenta la dura derrota ante Brasil en balonmano: "No hemos sido las guerreras" La selección española de balonmano femenino ha debutado con derrota en Los Juegos ante Brasil (29-18). La capitana se ha pasado por El Partidazo de COPE para analizar la situación. AGENCIAS Tiempo de lectura: 2' Actualizado 01:22 La selección española femenina de balonmano ha debutado este jueves en Los Juegos Olímpicos con una abultada derrota. Las guerreras han perdido por 29-18 frente a una Brasil que se ha mostrado fuerte en defensa, con su portera, Gabriela Moreschi deteniendo 14 de los 31 disparos que ha recibido. España ha conseguido grandes logros durante los últimos años, se ha proclamado subcampeona del mundo en 2019, y dos veces subcampeona de Europa, en 2008, y en 2014. Además, las españolas saben lo que es conseguir una medalla olímpica, lo hicieron logrando el bronce en Londres 2012. Lara González, presente en las platas de Japón 2019, y Hungría 2014, y capitana del combinado nacional, se ha pasado por el micrófono del Partidazo de COPE para analizar este duro resultado, y la manera de encarar lo que queda de torneo. Un inicio extremadamente duro La lateral izquierdo ha confesado que sienten "muchísima frustración", y ha admitido que no han estado a la altura del encuentro. Lara no ha sabido explicar cuál ha sido exactamente el motivo del mal rendimiento del equipo: "No sé si ha sido un exceso de presión, pero lo que sí que está claro es que en ningún momento nos hemos sentido cómodas. Estábamos como muy crispadas, con muchísima tensión". Aspecto táctico La internacional, más allá de poner el foco en el factor mental, también ha analizado que aspectos tácticos debe cambiar la selección española de cara a los próximos partidos. Ha afirmado que: Sabemos que podemos fallar arriba. Habrá días que estemos menos acertadas, es parte del juego, pero lo que sí que sabemos es que no podemos fallar abajo, es ahí donde está el problema". - Left6:No existe configuración de publicidad para el slot solicitado Esta mejora defensiva es lo que más preocupa a la capitana: "Es superimportante que hagamos un buen repliegue defensivo. La defensa tiene que empezar por ahí. Tenemos que ser muy duras, un muro, para ayudar a nuestras porteras". Cuando esta carencia esté resuelta: "A partir de ahí ya construir el juego, pero no podemos fallar abajo" insistía la jugadora. El próximo partido, una final España se medirá el domingo a Angola, en un partido que tras este resultado, es una final. Lara González no tiene dudas de como debe afrontar la selección este partido: "Tenemos que hacer reseteo, lo bueno que tienen este tipo de competiciones es que en dos días vuelves a competir. Está en nosotras darle la vuelta a esto, aún no hay nada determinado". Como capitana tiene claro que debe pedirle a las chicas: "Sinceramente, lo único que quiero es disfrutar de esto, que tengamos respeto por todo el trabajo que hemos estado haciendo, porque nos lo merecemos, hoy no hemos sido nosotras, no hemos sacado nuestro gen de identidad, no es la cara, no son las guerreras, no hemos sido nosotras, creo que lo podemos hacer muchísimo mejor. Nos lo merecemos y nos tenemos que quitar esa mochila, ese exceso de estrés o presión, empezar a disfrutar, empezar a poner en juego nuestro sistema, y darle la vuelta". También es consciente de por quién pedÍrselo: "Por nosotras, por toda la gente que ha estado durante todos estos años en el ciclo olímpico, todas las jugadoras que han estado durante la preparación". Por último, afirma que afrontan cada partido de la misma manera, y ahora toca Angola, por ello deben ir: "A muerte". author: ANI
title: PM Modi to lay foundation stone of NLC's 300 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan today | India News - Times of India
text: NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will virtually lay the foundation stone for the 300 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan today, an official statement from the Ministry of Coal said.The project is being set up with an investment of over Rs 1,756 crore to ensure affordable power supply to government entities.NLC India Limited, a leading Navratna CPSE under the Ministry of Coal, is establishing the power project in Barsingsar, in Rajasthan's Bikaner district, as part of the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy's CPSE Scheme.The project is equipped with cutting-edge technology, including high-efficiency bifacial modules manufactured in India.The solar project aligns with the Atma Nirbhar Bharat initiative led by Prime Minister Modi.The electricity generated will be transmitted through the pre-existing power transmission lines of Barsingsar Thermal Power Station, aiming to produce around 750 million units of green power annually, offsetting carbon dioxide emissions by approximately 18,000 million metric tonnes over its lifetime.The power usage agreement for the project has been inked with Rajasthan Urja Vikas Nigam Limited at a competitive tariff of Rs 2.52 per unit for the next 25 years, the release stated. The project is slated for commissioning by September 2024, with the potential to create employment opportunities for approximately 600 individuals indirectly during the project phase and 100 personnel during the operations & maintenance phase, it added.The official statement further said, "Furthermore, this project will enable Rajasthan to fulfil its renewable purchase obligation while contributing to the nation's journey towards achieving a net-zero future."NLCIL claims to operate the 250 MW Barsingsar Thermal Power Station (BTPS), providing cost-effective electricity to the state of Rajasthan. The company has secured a 300 MW solar project capacity in the CPSE Scheme Phase-II Tranche-III floated by the Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) through competitive bidding.

author: PTI
title: Venugopal criticises BJP for ‘politicising’ Ram Temple consecration - The Hindu
text:
Amidst indecision within the party over accepting the invitation extended to its top leaders to attend the consecration ceremony of the Ram temple in Ayodhya, the Congress on Friday criticised the BJP alleging that the saffron party was turning the religious event into a party programme.
All India Congress Committee general secretary in charge of organisation K.C. Venugopal said that senior Congress leaders, including Sonia Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, had been invited to the consecration ceremony, and added that they would decide at an “appropriate time” whether to attend it.
Talking to reporters, Mr. Venugopal said the senior leaders had received personal invitations for the January 22 function. “They will take a stand on their own. It’s not a matter in which we have to express our opinion in public. They will take a stand when the time comes,” Mr. Venugopal said.
Clear stand He noted that the Congress party had a clear stand on such matters and it functioned accordingly. “We will express our stand after discussing in our party forums and take a decision,” he added.
Mr. Venugopal criticised the BJP government, asking “whether it was right to turn such an event into a function of a party or a government”.
Besides Ms. Gandhi and Mr. Kharge, the party’s leader in Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has also been invited.
The Ram temple in Ayodhya is scheduled to be inaugurated on January 22. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, and more than 6,000 people are expected to attend the ‘Pran Pratishtha’ ceremony.

author: Maurizio De Santis
title: L’infortunio di Schwarz in Coppa del Mondo di sci è tremendo: ginocchio destro spaccato
text:
L’infortunio di Schwarz in Coppa del Mondo di sci è tremendo: ginocchio destro spaccato
La stagione di Marco Schwarz è finita nell'istante in cui ha perso il controllo degli sci e sulla pista di Bormio, in occasione della discesa di Coppa del Mondo di sci,
ha subito un incidente rovinoso al punto da provocare l'interruzione della gara e la necessità del trasporto in ospedale in elicottero.
L'esito degli esami diagnostici a cui è stato sottoposto è stato tremendo, s'è spaccato il ginocchio destro. Un termine forte ma, a giudicare dai riscontri medici, la definizione rende bene l'idea del danno procurato. Lo stesso comunicato della federazione austriaca di sci non dà adito a interpretazioni di sorta: "Nella caduta sulla pista di Bormio ha riportato una rottura del legamento crociato e del menisco mediale e un danno alla cartilagine del ginocchio destro". Schwarz dovrà stare fuori a lungo, attenderlo c'è un percorso di riabilitazione difficile dopo l'operazione.
Un brutto colpo per lo sciatore ma anche per il circuito iridato che perde per un grave infortunio l'atleta, attuale leader della classifica generale (e già campione nella combinata a Cortina d’Ampezzo 2021 e della Coppa del Mondo di slalom speciale), che finora aveva partecipato a tutte le tappe in calendario vincendo lo slalom di Madonna di Campiglio e conquistando tre secondi posti (lo slalom di Gurgl e i Giganti di Val d’Isère e Badia).
Come s'è fatto male Schwarz? Il campione carinziano ha perso l'equilibrio nella zona di Pian dell'Orso: sbilanciato nel movimento, le maggiori sollecitazioni le ha subite l'articolazione destra. I timori per la caduta sono stati successivamente confermati dai test effettuati a Innsbruck.
"A un certo punto della discesa – sono le parole di Schwarz riportate dal sito della Federazione austriaca – ho spinto dentro il mio ginocchio destro. Ho avuto subito la sensazione che qualcosa non andasse. Anche se sarà necessaria un’operazione posso dire sentirmi bene nonostante le circostanze. Voglio tornare ai miei livelli, darò tutto per questo".
A vincere la prova è stato il francese Sarrazin che ha preceduto lo svizzero Odermatt e il canadese Alexander. Nulla da fare per l'azzurro sul quale erano riposte buone speranze: Dominik Paris, re della Stelvio e reduce dal bel successo ottenuto in Val Gardena, è scivolato in una curva ed è finito fuori dai giochi.

author: Bijay Laxmi
title: Dragon's Den: Deborah Meaden Invests in Underground Electric Car Charging Solution, Kerbo Charge
text:
In a remarkable turn of events on the latest episode of Dragon's Den, aired on BBC One, two emerging entrepreneurs, Mike and Ben, made a compelling pitch for their groundbreaking electric car charging business, Kerbo Charge. They presented an innovative solution to a common problem faced by electric vehicle owners: the scarcity of accessible and convenient charging options. Their business focuses on installing underground charging cables for electric cars outside properties, a proposal that caught the attention of the Dragons, especially Deborah Meaden. Despite Peter Jones' skepticism concerning the fixed nature of the charging stations, Meaden saw a glimpse of the future in Kerbo Charge, leading her to invest £50,000 for a 6% share in the company, a decision that left Jones visibly shocked. This investment highlights the shifting dynamics in the electric vehicle industry and underscores the significant role of innovative solutions in driving the sector forward, particularly in light of the government's ambitious plan to halt the manufacturing of petrol and diesel vehicles by 2035.
The Leap Towards Electric Mobility
The electric vehicle (EV) market is on the cusp of a major transformation, with companies like LeapCharger Corporation pioneering a comprehensive ecosystem approach in the Middle East. This approach involves not just the deployment of DC fast charging infrastructure but also offering electric vehicle options and home charging solutions. The goal is to revolutionize the electric vehicle landscape and drive a positive change in the region's transportation sector. LeapCharger's initiative mirrors the ambitious vision of Kerbo Charge, showcasing a collective move towards sustainable and accessible electric mobility solutions.
The Dragons' Den Debate: A Reflection of Market Sentiments
The debate between Deborah Meaden and Peter Jones on Dragon's Den encapsulates the broader industry sentiments towards the adoption of electric vehicles and the infrastructure required to support them. Jones' skepticism about Kerbo Charge's business model, focusing on the fixed location of the chargers, highlights a significant concern regarding the adaptability and convenience of EV charging solutions. On the other hand, Meaden's decision to invest in Kerbo Charge reflects a strong belief in the future of electric mobility and the importance of innovative infrastructure to support it. Her investment decision is not just a vote of confidence in Mike and Ben's business but also an acknowledgment of the urgent need for sustainable transportation solutions.
Driving Positive Change in the EV Landscape
As the world moves closer to the 2035 deadline for ending the manufacture of petrol and diesel vehicles, the spotlight is increasingly on electric vehicles and the ecosystem supporting them. The investment by Deborah Meaden in Kerbo Charge is a testament to the growing confidence in electric mobility as a viable and sustainable alternative to traditional transportation methods. With companies like LeapCharger Corporation and Kerbo Charge leading the charge, the future of the electric vehicle industry looks promising. These developments not only signify a seismic shift in the automotive sector but also pave the way for a cleaner, greener, and more sustainable future.
In conclusion, the recent episode of Dragon's Den serves as a microcosm of the broader electric vehicle industry, reflecting the challenges, opportunities, and the dynamic interplay between innovation and market readiness. Deborah Meaden's investment in Kerbo Charge, despite Peter Jones' skepticism, underscores the growing importance of electric mobility and the critical role of innovative charging solutions in overcoming existing barriers. As the industry continues to evolve, the focus on sustainable transportation solutions will undoubtedly gain momentum, driving positive change in the global transportation landscape.

author: Elizabeth King
title: 4K sheltered at SMH during Milton, 7 babies delivered
text: - October 17, 2024 Loading Sarasota Memorial estimates its staff sheltered more than 4,000 people before, during and after Hurricane Milton between its downtown hospital campus, Venice hospital and freestanding ER in North Port. The head of the health system says the hospitals "stayed busy" and "fared well" throughout the storm, caring for everyone from those injured in the hurricane to four-legged family members to medical evacuees. “We had an influx of patients as the storm headed our way and hospitals around us began closing and evacuating patients,” David Verinder, CEO of Sarasota Memorial Health Care System, says in a statement. As Hurricane Milton approached the west coast of Florida, [Sarasota Memorial had 2,500 staff members lined up](https://www.businessobserverfl.com/news/2024/oct/09/sarasota-hospital-milton/) to stay multiple nights for the duration of the storm. “They reported for duty on Tuesday evening and helped provide care and support for more than 1,000 patients and medical evacuees,” Verinder says in an Oct. 10 statement. “And today, they continued to care for those who were injured or who developed serious medical conditions during the storm." Sarasota Memorial also delivered seven babies during the storm, according to Verinder. It was not business as usual at the hospitals and ER, which hosted more than just its regular patients. Among those receiving shelter and care at Sarasota Memorial were patients evacuated from surrounding hospitals, medically dependent people assigned by the county, physicians, staff and some of their children and pets. Dogs, cats and a bunny that provided emotional support for a nervous dog rode out the storm at Sarasota Memorial, officials say. "We couldn't be prouder of our team,” Verinder says. “They left their homes and many left their families to be here for our patients and community during one of the most alarming hurricanes approaching the Suncoast.” A new wave of staffers began arriving Thursday as road conditions allowed to relieve the initial response team, Sarasota Memorial officials say. “Thankfully, our facilities fared well, despite heavy winds, rain and surges nearby,” Verinder says. “Both hospitals are on high ground — our Sarasota campus at 19 feet and our Venice campus at 16.5 feet.” Sarasota Memorial Hospital plans to open its seven urgent care centers and network of outpatient imaging centers and physician offices as electricity, water and services become available. As of 11 a.m. on Oct. 10, only the Heritage Harbour Urgent Care Center had [reopened, while all others were being assessed](https://www.smh.com/hurricane). The goal is to be open across all sites by Monday, Oct. 14, officials say.

author: cts.com.tw
title: 黃疸知多少？醫曝「暗藏健康警訊」　出現5症狀要注意 - 華視新聞網
text:
吳欣蓉 綜合報導 / 台北市
每年的7月28日是世界肝炎日，而當肝臟發炎厲害時，就會出現黃疸表徵。臺北市立聯合醫院仁愛院區消化內科主治醫師王璞表示，黃疸是臨床常見的一種症狀，而非單一疾病，並指出黃疸依照其發生位置與機轉可分為三大類，也提醒民眾若有皮膚、眼白發黃，甚至尿液明顯變色等5症狀，應特別留意，因為代表身體的健康亮紅燈，之後若出現持續腹痛、體重急遽下降等任一情形者，更務必即刻就醫。
王璞表示，黃疸通常是因體內膽紅素過多而引起的。膽紅素是紅血球分解後產生的一種黃色色素，正常情況下會經由肝臟代謝後排出體外。當肝臟代謝系統出現異常，或膽紅素排出不順暢時，就會導致血中膽紅素累積，引發黃疸。
黃疸有3類 王璞指出，黃疸依照其發生位置與機轉可分為三大類，分別是溶血性黃疸（肝前性）、肝細胞性黃疸（肝性）及阻塞性黃疸（肝後性）：
1.溶血性黃疸（肝前性）
主因是紅血球大量破壞，產生過多膽紅素，超過肝臟處理能力，並常見於地中海型貧血、新生兒黃疸、自體免疫性溶血性貧血。
2.肝細胞性黃疸（肝性）
主因是肝細胞受損，無法有效代謝與排出膽紅素，並常見於肝炎（B型、C型）、肝硬化、肝癌、酒精性肝病、藥物性肝炎。
3.阻塞性黃疸（肝後性）
主因是膽汁排出通道受阻，膽紅素無法排出，反而倒流至血液，並常見於膽結石、膽管癌、胰臟癌、膽道狹窄。
黃疸初期不易察覺　5症狀要注意 王璞說明，黃疸初期可能不易察覺，但若出現5種症狀，就要提高警覺，包含眼白泛黃；從臉部、軀幹到四肢皮膚逐漸變黃；膽紅素經尿液排出，可能導致尿色深如紅茶；膽汁無法排入腸道，因此糞便顏色變淡；或者是皮膚癢，特別是阻塞性黃疸，膽鹽累積刺激神經末梢。
面對黃疸症狀出現，醫師會進行血液檢查，包含總膽紅素、直接與間接膽紅素、肝功能、膽鹼酯酶、凝血功能等觀測；影像檢查，例如腹部超音波、電腦斷層、核磁共振，了解是否有膽道阻塞或腫瘤；病毒檢測則是檢驗B型或C型肝炎病毒；以及必要時，做內視鏡逆行性膽胰管攝影或肝臟穿刺切片等特殊檢查。
出現5情形任一者　應即刻就醫 王璞也強調，若出現5種情形任一者，請即刻就醫，分別是黃疸迅速惡化或合併高燒；意識改變或嗜睡；持續腹痛、體重急遽下降；黑便或吐血(可能與肝硬化有關)；癌症家族史或近期檢查異常。
此外，王璞澄清幾種黃疸常見迷思，例如黃疸不一定是肝炎，雖然肝炎是常見原因之一，但膽管結石或腫瘤也可能導致黃疸；還有黃疸不只出現在大人，也會發生在新生兒，也就是常見生理性黃疸，但若持續或指數過高，也需要警覺病理性原因。
最後他也呼籲，黃疸雖是表象，但背後可能藏著重大健康警訊，因此日常應落實健康生活習慣，包括避免酗酒與不當藥物使用、定期進行健康檢查（特別是肝功能與B型、C型肝炎篩檢）、維持良好衛生習慣以防病毒感染，並注意均衡飲食、控制體重，預防脂肪肝等，都是保肝護膽的重要方法。
新聞來源：華視新聞

author: @WSMV
title: Ben’s BBQ to benefit Alzheimer’s Association
text: Ben’s BBQ to benefit Alzheimer’s Association The annual event will take place in Nolensville. NASHVILLE, Tenn. (WSMV) - When Erin and Josh Drummond first hosted Ben’s BBQ, it was a way to honor the memory of Erin’s beloved father, Ben McCloud, who was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s in 2018 and passed in 2020. McCloud was an avid golfer, cook, and philanthropist, and the most loving father and grandfather, his family said. For Josh and Erin Drummond, hosting this family-friendly event with proceeds to benefit the Alzheimer’s Association TN Chapter became a “family affair.” Josh joined the Alzheimer’s Association TN Chapter Board of Directors a few years ago to raise awareness and support the mission. Erin became the facilitator of an Alzheimer’s support group for caregivers under 40 years old. This year’s event will feature a special “tasting” smorgasbord. Several local restaurants will be featured at the BBQ, serving tastings of their food, including Corky’s BBQ and Bar-b-Cutie. There will also be popcorn from Kettle Corn Classic, cotton candy from Pandy Cotton Candy, and more. The event will also feature live music from the 90s cover band, “Happy Accidents.” This family-friendly event includes kids’ activities such as a bounce house, face painting by Fantasy Face Artistry (Dan Klepper), board breaking from Master Bae’s Taekwondo, customizable stuffed animals from Teddy Bear Mobile and yard games. A classic and custom car show will also be included in the event. There will be an onsite silent auction, including autographed guitars from Morgan Wallen and Hardy as well as items from many local businesses. The event will happen on Sunday, April 7, from 2 to 5 p.m. at Mill Creek Brewing in Nolensville. Tickets can be purchased by visiting [bensbbq.org](https://bensbbq.org/). Copyright 2024 WSMV. All rights reserved.
